docs.text: Welcome to MkDocs For full documentation visit mkdocs.org . Commands mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit. Project layout mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.
docs.title: Commands

docs.text: mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: Project layout

docs.text: API reference calculator add(a, b) A function for adding two integers Parameters: a ( int ) – the first number b ( int ) – the second number Returns: int – the sum of the two numbers: a + b Source code in src/calculator.py def add(a: int, b: int) -> int: """ A function for adding two integers Args: a: the first number b: the second number Returns: the sum of the two numbers: `a + b` """ return _add(a, b) multiply(a, b) A function for multiplying two integers. Parameters: a ( int ) – the first number b ( int ) – the second number Returns: int – the first number times the second number: a * b Source code in src/calculator.py def multiply(a: int, b: int) -> int: """ A function for multiplying two integers. Args: a: the first number b: the second number Returns: the first number times the second number: `a * b` """ return a * b subtract(a, b) A function for subtracting two integers Parameters: a ( int ) – the first number b ( int ) – the second number Returns: int – the first number minus the second: a - b Source code in src/calculator.py def subtract(a: int, b: int) -> int: """ A function for subtracting two integers Args: a: the first number b: the second number Returns: the first number minus the second: `a - b` """ return a - b
docs.title: Reference

docs.text: A function for adding two integers Parameters: a ( int ) – the first number b ( int ) – the second number Returns: int – the sum of the two numbers: a + b Source code in src/calculator.py def add(a: int, b: int) -> int: """ A function for adding two integers Args: a: the first number b: the second number Returns: the sum of the two numbers: `a + b` """ return _add(a, b)
docs.title: add

docs.text: A function for multiplying two integers. Parameters: a ( int ) – the first number b ( int ) – the second number Returns: int – the first number times the second number: a * b Source code in src/calculator.py def multiply(a: int, b: int) -> int: """ A function for multiplying two integers. Args: a: the first number b: the second number Returns: the first number times the second number: `a * b` """ return a * b
docs.title: multiply

docs.text: A function for subtracting two integers Parameters: a ( int ) – the first number b ( int ) – the second number Returns: int – the first number minus the second: a - b Source code in src/calculator.py def subtract(a: int, b: int) -> int: """ A function for subtracting two integers Args: a: the first number b: the second number Returns: the first number minus the second: `a - b` """ return a - b
docs.title: subtract
